# inactiveSchedulingPolicy

**Instance Property**

A policy you set to specify how a web view that’s not in a window handles tasks.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var inactiveSchedulingPolicy: WKPreferences.InactiveSchedulingPolicy { get set }
```

## Discussion

Set this to indicate how a web view that’s not in a window handles tasks; for example, when the web view is in a background tab in a browser. The default value is [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKPreferences/InactiveSchedulingPolicy-swift.enum/suspend].

A web view that’s not in a window is exempted from this policy if it is playing media, performing media capture, or performing another user-interactive activity.

## Setting Behavior Preferences

- **tabFocusesLinks**: A Boolean value that indicates whether pressing the tab key changes the focus to links and form controls.
- **isTextInteractionEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether to allow people to select or otherwise interact with text.
- **isElementFullscreenEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether a web view can display content full screen.
- **WKPreferences.InactiveSchedulingPolicy**: An enumeration that lists policies for how a web view that’s not in a window handles tasks.
